author: Staff Reporter
text:
Thousands of devotees witnessed ‘Thai Poosam’ car procession of Sri Periyanayaki Amman Temple here on Sunday evening.

In the early hours of the day, the idols of the God and the Goddess were brought to Shanmuga river for a holy dip. Amid chanting of hymns, the idols of Lord Muthukumaraswamy and Goddesses Valli and Deivanai were given a ritualistic bath in the river and taken back to the temple. Then, special pujas were conducted.

After the pujas, the aesthetically decorated idols were mounted on the car at an auspicious time between 11 a.m. and 12.30 p.m. Special pujas and aradhanas were performed to the deities on the car.

With “Arohara” renting the air, devotees drew the holy car along the four Car streets. As the temple elephant has gone to the rejuvenation camp for elephants, the temple administration roped in volunteers and temple staff to pull the holy car from its base. The celestial wedding took place in the temple between 7.30 p.m. and 8.30 p.m. on Saturday. The 10-day festival will conclude with the float festival on Wednesday.

Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments Minister R. Kamaraj, Collector T.N. Hariharan and HR &CE Joint Commissioner P. Rajamanickam among others pulled the car. Padyatris were the worst-affected as they were directed to take a long route to come of the Giri Veedhis. Pilgrims who wanted to visit Sri Dhandayuthapniswamy Temple had to walk at least one km to reach the ‘Nilayam’.
title: Thousands witness car festival at Palani
